status_notes: Case Invalid. This is incorrect. The parking restrictions are for Monday-Friday from 6pm to 10am. This means:. Monday from  6pm until Tuesday at 10am Resident Parking only. Tuesday from 6pm until Wednesday at 10am Resident Parking only. Wednesday at 6pm until Thursday at 10am Resident Parking only. Thursday at 6pm until Friday at 10am Resident Parking only. From 10am on Friday through Monday at 6pm, Resident Parking Restrictions are not in effect and anyone can park there. Resident parking restrictions from 6pm to 10am means ONLY resident can park from 6pm to 10am. Monday through Friday means those restrictions start Monday at 6pm and end Friday at 10am.
description: Resident parking is 6pm to 10am Monday - Friday. So from 6pm until 12:01am Friday is Resident parking restricted and 12:01am Sunday (is actually Monday) until 10am Monday Is Resident Parking Restricted. You cannot park before 10am Mondays or before 12am Fridays. Thats is what our signs reads. Please come and tag. Thank you

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. . The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. . It is an important City service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes. . Below is the steps taken to do the permanent repair. . The construction process is to dig out 6.5 to 7.5" inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride. The contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride. . YOU ARE OBSERVIBNG THE PERMANENT PATCHES IN THE BASE COURSE PHASE/ THEY WILL BE TOPPED TO GRADE SOON. We apologize for the inconvenience. I hope this explanation clarifies things for you. . If not please don't hesitate to call me. . Sincerely,. . Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office. 617-438-8517 Cell.

The construction process is to dig out 6.5 to 7.5" inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride. The contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride. We apologize for the inconvenience. . If not please don't hesitate to call me. . Sincerely,. . Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office. 617-438-8517 Cell.

status_notes: Case Resolved. The sidewalk surrounding this block has applied-paver material which makes installation of bicycle racks highly undesirable for maintenance considerations. Many other sidewalks in this immediate area are of an inappropriate material, hollow sidewalks, or inadequate width to maintain clearances. However, thank you for voicing your support for additional racks in the FiDi area. We will be planning new installations and repairs in this area for the coming fiscal year. And your request will be certainly be taken into account. The City does not have a specific prohibition on affixing a bicycle to a City-owned sign post on City-maintained property, though specific exceptions are do stand in effect. There is a prohibition on affixing the bike to a sign post indicating accessible parking spaces, loading zones, valet spaces, and the like. Also prohibited explicitly is affixing a bicycle to any object which impedes or restricts the pedestrian passageway/walkway under 4 feet in width (in accordance with ADA requirements).

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. . The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to National Grid. . We have asked National Grid to restore the sidewalk by the end of next week. However there is a possible  National Grid strike beginning tomorrow night. The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks sidewalk cuts left in HMA needing to be restored. . The CIU Inspector will periodically check the condition of the asphalt patch. . If the asphalt patch does not meet our standards they will need to repair the asphalt ASAP until the permanent restoration is scheduled. . The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair. .
